FuncDef: The issu check command is used to check the system before an ISSU. The check result determines the ISSU method.

ParaDef.Info:

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check whether an ISSU can be performed on the system, you can run the
issu check command to check the system before the ISSU. The check items include:
Current environment where the system is runningCompleteness and validity of the new system softwareHardware compatibilitySoftware compatibility
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.

Prerequisites
The new system software has been uploaded to the main board on the device.
Configuration Impact
After the issu check command is executed, the system imports the new system software information into a database, checks the environment where the system is running, including the CPU usage, disk space, and memory usage, checks whether the new system software is compatible with hardware and with the earlier system software, and checks the ISSU method to be used.
Follow-up Procedure
If no error information is displayed in the output of the issu check command, the check result is success. You can also run the display issu check-result command to view the ISSU check result.
If the issu check command output shows that the ISSU is feasible, run the issu start command to start the ISSU.
Precautions
ISSU is not supported on VSUF boards or by services
